text.p: These were the headlines on Kuku Radio at noon. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The Russian central bank said the St Petersburg tax police did not have any right to freeze the accounts of Baltic banks in St Petersburg on July 31.
- Armed robbers escaped with 700,000 kroons in a Hollywood style bank robbery in Saku, a town near Tallinn.
- Estonia still has the lowest petrol prices of the Baltic countries despite having the highest average wage.
